name: eric
text: toilet party, an idea whose time has come.

name: straw
text:
A couple hooligans and I would often hole up in the bathroom if there was a tub full of beer in that bathroom

And the places we went, there usually was

name: deancain29
text: A comment left by deancain29 was marked lame too many times and excluded. (marked lame by tekende, Jordstar, science, goocifer, regrepsnefpoh, ferdinand, Siah, cathaoir, Boyd)

name: rodneystubbs
text: Excellent

name: luckypyjamas
text: Decent

name: connellingus
text: Yeah, I read that comic, too.

name: saint
text: you must be wearing a misfits shirt, carry a bottle of scotch, and smell like a distillery for this line to work. And it wouldn't hurt to have a handlebar mustache.

name: dusty
text: But if you don't say that people won't let you know. They just avoid you like they're little miss perfect bowel control.

name: waddlerz
text: He wants to know if he shits himself as he enters a party centered around a toilet

name: dj_douche
text: bathroom is the sweetest spot at a house party. close to the source of the beer, best placed for peeing or vomiting if needed, good acoustics. well played.

name: deimosrising
text: A bittersweet strip, as it signaled the end of the Scotland saga in Lyle's blog, probably my favorite "story arc" in the blogs.

name: catachresis
text: Aye. The way it carried into the strip was damn special though.

name: jujubeesforjesus
text: Exactly.  The best blog story brought in in so subtle a manner it's possible to never know it happened.  The clarity he gains in the convent just goes to show that Lyle owns it.

name: tonyhighwind
text: I, too, enjoyed Lyle's Scotland arc, but I don't think he "gained" clarity in the convent.  I'm pretty sure that's just how Lyle's brain operates when there's no outside influence.  It makes you wonder what the dude could have done if he never picked up a bottle.

name: davidbs
text: I wouldn't have toilet parties, but hall parties are something else; people get all squeezed together in ways that are both uncomfortable and arousing.

name: sargasm
text: Teodor is dancing and having fun!  I am glad to see that, as he seems to have less fun than Beef does, despite the lack of depression.

name: featurelessvoid
text: Yeah, Ray relented and let him play the Cure for just one song.

name: c_dizzle
text: Tódore's dance...he's swiveling, no? That's....adorable.

name: shutup_shutup
text: That dancing completely makes this strip and I totally never noticed it before.  It's amazing!  That and the bottles on top of Andy.

name: cpnglxynchos
text: he dances as Emeril does herein

name: trevor
text: After being held captive by the catholic church for months, Lyle is now back to being so drunk that he needs people to tell him if he has shat his pants.

name: luke_johnson
text: Pretty sure the alt-text goes "Lyle picked up some manners in Scotland"

name: heccibiggs
text: Before his trip, he would not think it necessary for anyone to bother him if he shit himself.

name: qatipay
text: Is that Vlad and Liebot's rectangular friend from "Success!" with beer bottles on his head?

name: qatipay
text: Andy! That's his name.

name: deancain29
text: Liebot's shoes. perfect.

name: direhaggis
text: Why would Vlad call Ray about a party when they're already at the door and the doorbell works?

name: connellingus
text: Ray probably didn't answer the door very quickly, so Vlad tried calling him in case he didn't hear the bell.

name: sol_tee
text: there's the doorbell, maybe there is someone at the door?

name: deancain29
text: I love Teodors face in Panel 2

name: boyd
text: I find it heartwarming that I live in a place where Lyle goes to have fun.

name: doc_rostov
text: You live in Ray's bathroom?

name: boredom_man
text: He lives in a world of shit.

name: spinynorman
text: The winds of shit are blowing, Randy.

name: sp1derbaby
text: It grew up as a little shitspark, from the ol' shitflame, and then it turned into a shit bonfire, and then, driven by the winds of its monumental ignorance, it turned into a raging shitfire storm.

name: clever-nickname
text: Lyle's line will remind me of Trainspotting until the day I die.

name: honesttom
text: I love the entire panel devoted to Blister saying "HEY MAN".

name: fineoakstructure
text: Plus, it's kind of a call back to the original "Party" (maybe the last time we saw Ray and Blister together?  I can't do the research now), with Ray's note to Teodor on Penny's gift.

name: heyman
text: Besides, "Hey Man" is just one of the most friendly greetings out there.

name: caseyb3
text: The exceptionally long HEY . . . MAN does it for me too. This is just great.

name: all-star951
text: Ray says "Bilster" instead of "Blister" in panel 6. Typo?

name: all-star951
text: Dang tripperday beat me to this. (see below)

name: jordstar
text: I've reread this arc a few times and never had such a big re-LOL as now, when I noticed for the first time Andy carrying three bottles on his head.

name: jordstar
text: And for a re-re-LOL: Highlander reference in the title.

name: fineoakstructure
text: That's my favorite part of the strip; though I like to think that LB and Vlad are just using Andy as a place to put their empties...the guy is basically a wall, so why not?

name: fineoakstructure
text: d'oh, scratch that...someone beat me to it (see next strip).

name: phthoggos
text: ditto

name: gussiejives
text:
The question should be: when ISN'T Vlad workin' the mojo?


The answer is never.

name: xiaomimi
text:
Today's Blogs

Mr. Bear: One might say that Lyle is back.

name: the_doz
text: You are on a mission.

name: direhaggis
text: Todd and Nice Pete must still be exchanging shanking lore.

name: drago25
text: I love that Ray's idea of "get back to work" is get back to watching the blue toilet bowl water.

name: beansdooma
text: same panel 3 as the previous strip

name: donnatron
text: Ah. Party in the Shower was a good one with my friends. Especially in my roommate's fraternity house...one big shower, lots of people, and even more alcohol.

name: tripperday
text:
Does anyone else see Ray saying "Bilster" instead of "Blister"?

I love that feeling at a party when a bunch of people you know and haven't seen together for a while start showing up.

name: atticusonline
text: HEY MAN

name: carlyle
text: Oh classic (Lyle).

name: deusoma
text: It has been years since I first discovered Achewood, and I've read through the archives at least five times since then, and yet this is the first time I ever noticed the Highlander reference on this comic. I love you, Achewood. Run away with me and bear my half-man half-webcomic children.
